caption.title: Comparison of simulated and estimated dispersal kernels.
caption.p: From left to right: kernels with the minimum, lower quartile, median, upper quartile and maximum Kullback-Leibler (KL) distances (posterior mean), for all chains with non-negligible mean posterior likelihood. Estimations (red) under the most exhaustive scheme (Î˜ 4) are based on simulated epidemics with short-, medium- and long-range kernels (from top to bottom; black). Kernels are represented by their marginal probability density function f 1 D . The mean KL distance is indicated for each estimation.
Click here for additional data file.
